DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to asses the efficacy of the spirometry and a minimal smoking cessation counselling intervention to quit smoking after a year in patients older than 40 years, smokers of more than 10 packs-year and without a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) diagnosis.
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness of Spirometry as a Motivational Tool to Quit Smoking
DOC.criteria: Active smokers over 40 years and more than 10 packyears Previous diagnosis of respiratory disease (asthma, COPD, interstitial lung disease) that cause alteration of spirometric pattern. Patients with limitations in performing spirometry Age greater than 80 years Institutionalized patients Patients with a life expectancy less than 1 year Spirometry in the past 2 years
